Description: Executive stamp (vessel): three line Kufic inscription. Stamp deformed. With attached piece of vessel. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: All illustrated examples of Yazīd b. Tamīm's executive stamp are from the one die, which was used on both weights and vessel stamps. Its appearance on, a half-raṭl meat weight has been recorded under OA+ 4536, a damaged example on a raṭl has been illustrated by Miles (1948, 50) and one surviving alone on a fragment of a disc weight described by Balog (1976, 271). Vessel stamps are numerous. Originally, of course, they would have been used jointly with vessel stamps showing the denomination and with the name of ʿAbd al-Malik b. Marwān. Bibliography: Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (159)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Yazīd b. Tamīm
